user_profile: You are a graduate student in folklore at Brown University living in Providence. You're organizing a small, ghost-themed dinner for classmates after seminar. You cook in a tiny apartment kitchen with just a stovetop and a toaster oven, and you’re on a tight student budget. You’re a lacto-ovo vegetarian who loves experimenting with heat (including ghost peppers) but you want options that won’t overwhelm spice-sensitive friends. You’re into ghosts, haunted folklore, and playful, thematic presentation.
task_description: Help the user design a ghost-themed, vegetarian, budget-friendly dinner menu for 6, including at least one optional ghost pepper component; provide a complete shopping list, per-item cost targets, and a 2-hour prep timeline for a small kitchen (stovetop + toaster oven). Include spice-level alternatives and safety tips for handling superhot chilies.
first_user_prompt: I’m hosting a ghost-themed dinner for six classmates on a $50 budget. I’ve got a stovetop and a toaster oven only. Can you plan a vegetarian menu with one optional ghost pepper item, make a shopping list with rough prices, and give me a 2-hour prep schedule? Please include milder substitutions for anyone who can’t handle the heat.
